title: Agribusiness as a sustainable tool to mitigate rural-urban migration of youth in Kenya

tasks.task: Adapting youth perspectives on agriculture in Kenya.
subtasks: Recognizing the pressure of urban migration due to limited employment.
Understanding the importance of retaining rural farmers to sustain food production.
Highlighting the perception that agriculture is associated with poverty and low status.
Presenting agribusiness as a viable alternative to traditional farming and urban employment.
Discussing the success stories of young farmers in poultry projects and the potential for entrepreneurship.
Emphasizing technological advancements in agriculture to attract youth.
Encouraging diverse roles within the agriculture sector beyond traditional farming.
Addressing the changing mindset of youth towards agriculture as a viable career choice.
Promoting the significance of youth engagement in addressing food security and population growth.

tasks.task: Changing youth's mindsets towards agricultural careers.
subtasks: Demonstrating the profitability and modernity of agriculture through educated youth involvement.
Advocating for agribusiness as a cool and fashionable career path.
Encouraging youth to start their own agricultural enterprises with support from the FAO and local governments.
Highlighting the opportunities available in agribusiness such as transportation, marketing, and input supply.
Stressing the importance of education in unlocking entrepreneurial skills for youth in agriculture.

tasks.task: Overcoming the stigma of agricultural work.
subtasks: Challenging the notion that agriculture is only for less educated individuals.
Showing the shift in mindset where agriculture is perceived as respectable and lucrative.
Sharing success stories of educated youth who have transitioned from white-collar jobs to agricultural entrepreneurship.
Acknowledging the frustration experienced by youth who attempt urban employment.

tasks.task: Promoting rural agribusiness as a solution to migration.
subtasks: Presenting agribusiness as an alternative to migrating for employment.
Highlighting the accessibility of rural areas for market opportunities due to proximity to urban centers.
Illustrating the potential for young farmers to supply local markets and hotels.
Discussing the benefits of agribusiness in sustaining the local economy and retaining talent.
